title.narrative: INCLUSIVE QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education and other institutions in charge of education for children and adolescents, offer well- structured and relevant education alternatives, which lead to a decrease in school exclusion, particularly in areas with higher exclusion levels, populations with disabilities and other vulnerable groups, all in accordance with diverse intercultural settings., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable and excluded children and adolescents have access to, remain and complete their early childhood development and pre-school and secondary education responding to their needs, potential and intercultural contexts.

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/001 INCLUSIVE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education and other institutions in charge of education for children and adolescents, offer well-structured and relevant education alternatives, which lead to a decrease in school exclusion, particularly in areas with higherexclusion levels, populations with disabilities and other vulnerable groups, all in accordance with diverse intercultural settings.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF undertook to prevent educational exclusion by helping MoE strengthen the Early Alert Strategy and adopt procedures for optimizing the quantity, quality, and timeliness of the resources going to the 314 schools with the highest percentage of exclusion. It promoted the STEAM strategy with a gender perspective in 80 schools and implemented Learning Passport to provide virtual education for more than 1,200,000 students, as well as the platform for professional and vocational guidance called Orienta2. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed in the first half of 2018.

target.value: 2022:Baseline to be developed in the first half of 2018.

title.narrative: Student governments in areas of greater exclusion have participatory and advocacy mechanisms in their education centers.(57723)

baseline.value: Education centers don't offer student governments adequate participatory and advocacy mechanisms.

target.value: 2022:One third of student governments in high-exclusion areas have leading roles in policy-building processes at their education centers through participatory and advocacy mechanisms.

title.narrative: The evaluation of the Yo Me Apunto / Exclusion Strategy Program has been carried out.(57724), Text

baseline.value: The Yo Me Apunto program is a successful strategy that strives to reduce school exclusion that hasn't been evaluated.

target.value: 2022:The Evaluation of Yo Me Apuntoled to the strengthening and upscaling of the program.

actual.value: 2021:Yo me Apunto Strategy has been completed.
